metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10134 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SQL injection vulnerability in Zabbix before 2.2.14 and 3.0 before 3.0.4 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the toggle_ids array parameter in latest.php. It was discovered that Zabbix incorrectly handled certain inputs. A remote attacker could posibly use this issue to execute arbitrary SQL commands.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10134` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zabbix package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm1').
